pros: Very nice manager, staff works well as a team
cons: I don't have any! It was great

review_title: They do NOT compensate for experience!
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Syracuse, NY
pros: self scheduling is available on some units, which really does allow for a good work/home life balance.
cons: Management hires brand new, inexperienced staff at the same or higher pay rates than the loyal, experienced staff that has been with the organization for years. When asked for pay raises, they just say it's out of their hands and defer you to someone in HR who ultimately ends up denying your request for a raise. It definitely devalues those with experience.

review_title: Work as much as you want but deal with hostile work environment
job_title: PCT Patient Care Tech in Syracuse, NY
pros: Able to pick up shifts as much as possible. Float Pool was ran efficiently and had great management
cons: Certain employees in CPEP were allowed to run the unit. This included doing as they pleased on the shift, telling our PCT's what to do when the charge nurse is in charge, talking badly about staff and management openly in training sessions and during work hours. They were also allowed to make racial and derogatory comments to patients. When I reported the inappropriate behavior no one at HR returned my call until AFTER I quit.

pros: Very diverse workforce and community
cons: Poor management don’t value hiring within

pros: Working with like minded dedicated people. Support from management.
cons: Low pay for type of work.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Syracuse, NY
pros: Pay, coworkers, cost of health insurance
cons: No security in position, owned by large multi state company

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Syracuse, NY
pros: Salary competitive, benefits competitive, parking OK
cons: Negative, nasty work environment w little support

review_title: Would have stayed if I had had a better preceptor
pros: Nursing itself is awesome and I loved my job and being a floor nurse. I loved taking care of my patients. The pay was pretty good. If you get a lunch break the cafeteria was great with really nice staff. I loved going to other units. Whenever I floated to other units they were way more accepting of me than my home unit, which made the assignments more fun and bearable.
cons: Unsafe acuity to nurse ratios, sometimes nurses wouldn't get proper breaks. Management did not adequately respond to complaints made by me and other nurses on my behalf about my preceptor. Other weaker minded nurses followed preceptor's lead and became passive aggressive. This is not speculation I was told by one of the stronger minded nurses that she had it out for me. On top of unsafe ratios exacerbated by the pandemic I quit. I was scared for my license and had a few people I could trust during my shift since many of them were poisoned against me.

pros: Great people! Most Everyone is helpful and caring.
cons:
Parking, no breaks. 
The staff ratio is unsafe for nurses and patients. Results in poor care

pros: Benefits though maternity cannot proceed with medically indicated pregnancy terminations
cons: Do not protect pregnant employees from working with covid patients.

job_title: ICU Registered Nurse in Tacoma, WA
pros: For 5th Floor Cardiovascular ICU only: very supportive direct management team and fellow RNs.
cons: Pay is not competitive with surrounding hospitals.

pros: Competitive salary and benefits, parking.
cons: Patient load, low staffing levels, 12 hour shifts

review_title: Used to be better before Trinity took over
pros: Great coworkers, great cardiac surgery program
cons: Trinity health has cut costs and corners wherever they could to save a buck.

pros: At one point fair pay and benefits
cons: Forget everything you know, cause they know it all !!!!

pros: Easy job and met some great people
cons: Racist work environment and unfair treatment towards minorities.

pros: Having to work every third weekend and nurse manager that’s willing to work with your schedule

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Syracuse, NY
pros: Nice staff, teamwork on certain units
cons: Overworked and understaffed most shifts

job_title: Registered Nurse BSN in Syracuse, NY

cons: No hazard pay, lower pay for overtime than other hospitals during covid

job_title: Business Applications Analyst in Syracuse, NY
pros: Some great people and programs
cons: Once it was acquired by Trinity it has been nonstop changes, poor management being promoted, a lot of disorganization. Morale seems to be low

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Syracuse, NY
pros: Work well around school schedule
cons: If you don't make minimum number of hours, they assume you want to quit.

pros: Used to be halfway decent.
cons: This place turned into a nightmare to work for. So much turnover.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Liverpool, NY
pros: The new supervisor, Keith, is great and treats people really well.  If you work during the daytime you will take a lot of calls, so if you like being really busy you will be happy with the workload.
cons: I was told by HR, when I was hired, that there would be raises.   And since I work online to supplement my income I thought I could hang in there at $10.10 an hour for a little while and then move up within the company,and thought certainly the raises would come.   Nope, no raises in three years for anyone.  They just don't pay well period.   I was not learning anything new, was not growing, so I left.

review_title: Upper management doesn't care about Heath care or the employees, but the people make this place work!
job_title: Human Resources Analyst in Syracuse, NY
pros:
Caring wonderful co workers, great teamwork and friendships were made.   Salaries are somewhat fair, benefits are just ok.

Parking is available at a small cost, security is wonderful.
cons:
Upper management is clueless and only cares about covering their tail and profit.  For a health care facility I was shocked at how many people must report to work sick, until I became ill at work one day, I reported to my manager and informed him how bad I felt, to my surprise he gave me a hard time and couldn't believe I couldn't finish my shift, he finally told me go home but I'm not paying you

Not a good career place as turn over is very high

job_title: Home Care Nurse in Syracuse, NY
pros: The coworkers are the best. Salary is very good. Benefits are so-so
cons: Management does not give 1 fig about their employees. The only way to work your way up the career ladder is to be related to someone in management. For a healthcare facility it is surprising at how inconsiderate and even punitive they are for employees taking care of their own health. It's very sad that the only thing that matters to management is their craving to save a buck, even at patient expense.

review_title: Pretty good, Pay is not great for behavioral health
job_title: Behavioral Health Counselor in Syracuse, NY
pros: They have great benefits, offer training to advance your medical career, and in general provide a very positive upbeat work environment.
cons: For behavioral health services they have a relatively small program that leaves little room for advancement. They pay is somewhat competitive but still is low compared to similar positions at upstate.

pros: M-F daytime hours, decent insurance, decent pay, being able to build relationships with clinical staff, job is easy once you are trained properly.
cons: cost of benefits are so expensive for a family plan, new attendance policy doesn't allow for "life happens", management plays favorites, pay for parking in an open lot that patients don't even have to pay for, raises are so minimal that it doesn't even make a difference.

pros: Great Place to work, caring people and friendly atmosphere, They care about their employees and will give you a chance to work out issues.  Also they have great benefits
cons: Slow pay raises.  used to be .25 to .50  cents for a raise?   not even close to cost of living increases

pros: Job security, diverse patient population. The co workers that really care help. Unfortunately becoming few and far between.
cons: I find it hypocritical that st joes constantly talks about their vision and values when all they care about is the almighty dollar. No sick time, poor communication skills in management, and staff is not valued. Very much the you don't like it go somewhere else attitude.

pros: Teaching, not-for-profit hospital, CEO is a nurse, team-orientated, deals with high-risk, impoverished patients, great learning opportunities
cons: Pay is less competitive than other hospitals such as Mayo and Scottsdale Healthcare. Yet, if you do not need any benefits and have more than 2 yrs of experience the pay is great.

pros: Met a lot of good friends. Close to home and advancement opportunities. Job changed every day and weekbto week kept you on your toes.
cons: Low pay sort staffed that called in way to often but when are team was all present it was always smooth, we stocked all the nursing units and placed orders for the next day.

pros: Great culture, people are caring get and nice to work with
cons: Inconsistently with policy organizational. Nursing is at forefront....if your not a nurse, prepare to feel neglected to some degree.  New merger with Trinity health resulted in increased insurance premiums and more expensive with fewer coverage options.

review_title: Good so far, has good starting pay for behavioral health however few opportunities for raises/upward mobility.
job_title: Behavioral Health Counselor in Syracuse, NY
pros: Management is good, pay is fairly good, they acknowledge hard workers and provide an open forum for issues you may have.
cons: Raises are very rare, promotions even less so, i suppose if thats the worst of it its not so bad.

review_title: Great People, but a real lack of direction from Management
pros: Some of the best co-workers, most clinical area's are modern, but business office are not so.
cons: Real lack of management, from Manager up to VP.   Many have no computer skills, can't create a project plan or even an agenda for a meeting.   Many have been in their jobs for years and don't want to think out side the box or do anything but glide thru day to day

job_title: Nutritional Services Patient Representative in Charlotte, NC
pros: Great place to start in healthcare,good benefits and work available.
cons: Need to value and have compassion for employees.Need a better rewards program versus waiting for donations from alumni.Will not let you transfer or advance to better yourself.

job_title: Student Nursing Assistant in Syracuse, NY
pros: Feels like family. The nursing staff are all amazing. The nursing school is top notch and the employee education benefits are great.
cons: None. This hospital is amazing. I would want my family members to go there. Always the best top notch nursing care at this hospital

review_title: My experience working at St. Joseph's was moderate-not excellent, but not bad.
pros: I liked working with different patients, a lot of the staff were helpful and nice.
cons: High stress, frustrating staff to work with

job_title: Nutritional Service Coordinator in Mattydale, NY
pros: Very friendly place to work. .great benefits including medical and retirement ...pay is very similar to other positions in the area
cons: Growing to big to fast...expanding to fast and hiring to many employees to fast causing layoffs being over staffed in some areas. .

job_title: Staff RN in Saint Paul, MN
pros: They have great team work
cons: There are some days that the job are tedious.

pros: Department staff were great to work with! With all that management dumped on us, we kept each other afloat!
cons: It's like living in fear day to day...senior management couldn't manage themselves out of a paper bag. And yet, they have 6 figure salaries. A case of too many chiefs, and not enough Indians.

pros: Strong, shared governance council, Magnet certified, NICHE and baby friendly .  Treat staff very well. Many awards for excellence.
cons: Very large hospital, in large metropolian area. No, children programs.  Many upper level  management team members.

cons: Float position so you never know where you will be till you show up for your shift.
